name: NYC Bagels
instructions: Combine water, sugar and yeast together
Combine Flour & Salt and then add stirred liquid to combine
Knead dough for about 10 minutes until stiff
Rise dough for about 1 1/2 hours
Cut dough into equal sizes (8 large/12 small), roll into a dough ball
Cover dough with plastic wrap and proof for 30 min
Punch hole in middle and shape as bagel
In slowly boiling water add bagels - 2 minutes one side and then 1 to 2 minutes second side
Bake at 425 F for 20-25 min, turning after about 15 min

name: Artisan Crackers
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Combine the flour, salt, honey, and olive oil by hand
Add the water and shape into a ball. Let the dough rest for about 30 minutes.
1 tsp Salt
add rosemary or pepper, then roll out each individual piece of dough as thin as you possibly can. Brush top with olive oil and sprinkle salt as desired. Cut into strips or desired shape

Bake for 4-6 minutes, but check periodically to make sure it’s not getting too brown – flip each cracker piece and bake another 4-6 minutes. Once they are the color you like take them out and turn off oven. After 30 min put back into now warm oven and leave for a few hours to allow them to fully dry out if you prefer

name: Fig Jam
instructions: For a thick jam simmer for 50 to 60 minutes. For a looser jam simmer for 40 minutes
Place lemon rind OR juice of lemon and all other ingredients into a medium, heavy bottomed saucepan. Stir to combine.
Bring contents to a boil over medium high heat, stirring frequently. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 40 to 60 minutes.
Discard thym stems and lemon peel. Pulse jam with an immersion blender to chop up the fig skins if desired.

name: Overnight Bread
instructions: Heat over to 475 with cast iron in the oven
Shape dough and then proof for up to 30 min while oven is heating
Bake 30 minutes with the lid on (or foil) and then 25-30 min with the lid off

name: Cinnamon Rolls
instructions: Oven 430 F. Mix dry ingredients and then add room temperature Butter, mix with a fork. Add Buttermilk and mix.
Roll out the dough into rectangle
Spread room temperature Butter onto dough. Mix Brown Sugar and Cinnamon and then press into sugar until it becomes moist.
Roll up and cut into 12 rolls. Line a baking tin and place rolls evenly in pan. Brush tops with Buttermilk
Bake 15-20 minutes until golden brown
Frosting - Mix/whip Cream Chesse & Butter, then add Sugar and Vanilla. Spread over rolls as soon as they come out of the oven

name: Cinnamon Roll Frosting
instructions: Frosting - Mix/whip Cream Cheese & Butter, then add Sugar and Vanilla. Spread over rolls as soon as they come out of the oven

name: Hot Cocoa
instructions: Add 3 tablespoons of the Hot Chocolate mix to 8 oz milk or water into a saucepan and stir. Simmer on medium/low heat for 2 minutes.

name: Caramel or Peanut Butter Brownie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F
Grease and line baking tin
Melt butter and cocoa and then add brown sugar to it
Add eggs and beat them one at a time, then mix in the flour
Put into the baking tin
Bake for 30 minutes
comments: delicious and best with peanut butter cups

name: Suzie's Plum Sauce
instructions: Slice plums in 1/2, remove stone. Roughly chop the onion and garlic.
Combine all ingredients in a large pot and bring to a boil, stirring regularly
Lower heat to a simmer and reduce until sauce consistency

name: Homemade British Mixed Spice
instructions: Combine all spices together and it will make about 1/4 c in total

name: Classic Pesto
instructions: Using a food processor combine Basil, Garlic and Nuts
Add Cheeses and Salt and combine
Slowly add olive oil until mixed through
comments: can swap out pine nuts for pistachios or walnuts. Recipe makes about 1 cup

name: Chocolate Coconut Fudge Jar - Dr Libby
instructions: In food processor blend coconut until creamy and smooth
Add vanilla, maple syrup, cocoa powder, salt and blend until well combined

name: Whiskey Sour
instructions: Mix, shake and and drink

name: Margarita
instructions: Mix together and shake with ice

name: Artist Special Park Hyatt NYC
instructions: mix together with ice, serve in martini glass
comments: Park Hyatt NYC - The Living Room bar across from Carnegie Hall

name: Chris's Mojito
instructions: Combine lime juice, sugar, and mint leaves in glass
Add crushed ice about 3/4 way up
Churn vigorously  with a bar spoon
Add rum and churn again
Top with soda water and more ice as desired

name: Simple Caramel Syrup
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a small saucepan
Cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until everything is melted
Simmer for about 6 minutes or until the syrup is slightly reduced and thickened to a loose honey consistency
comments: super easy and one of the best caramel sauces

name: Apricot Jam Sauce
instructions: Sautee green onion in a little bit of oil
Add jam, stock and water, stir and simmer for 5 to 7 min until thickened
